Name: Pyongyang
Description: The capital and largest city of North Korea, known for its monumental architecture, government buildings, and political significance.

Name: South Pyongan
Description: A province located south of Pyongyang, known for its industrial areas and historical sites.

Name: North Pyongan
Description: A northern province of North Korea, known for its mountainous terrain and proximity to the border with China.

Name: Chagang
Description: A province located in the northwestern part of North Korea, known for its forests and remote mountainous areas.

Name: Ryanggang
Description: A province in the northern part of the country, bordering China, with a significant focus on agriculture and mining.

Name: Hamgyong
Description: A region in the northeastern part of North Korea, with a coastline along the Sea of Japan (East Sea) and known for its natural resources.

Name: Kangwon
Description: A province located in the eastern part of North Korea, known for its mountainous landscapes and scenic beauty.

Name: South Hamgyong
Description: A province in the southeastern region of North Korea, which is industrially significant with many factories.
